title: Crypto Library
author: Crypto Library
content: Is there is option to check in a thread or local board how many merit are transact in a day or week or month ?Thanks in advance to the community.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: You can check the data here Bitcointalk Merit DashboardAs for local board you can check this thread, usually it updated every month [CHARTS] Brief monthly overview of the local boards activity

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Library on June 17, 2022, 02:46:27 PMIs there is option to check in a thread or local board how many merit are transact in a day or week or month ?Thanks in advance to the community.  There are multiple ways of seeing the information on the Merit Dashboard. Perhaps the easiest would be to use this view:https://public.tableau.com/views/BitcointalkMeritDashboard/ReceivedMeritSubsectionIII?:language=es-ES&:display_count=n&:origin=viz_share_linkOn the above tab, you can change the time scale granularity to show the data from year through to day grouping (use the Date Level Selector). You can include or exclude boards/local boards (subsection selector) for comparison purposes.Bear in mind that the data is updated only one per week, generally on Fridays.

comments.body: I'm also curious when I can give merit to other members?I wanted to show gratitude to one poster but I couldn't send some merit.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: vifzor on June 21, 2022, 12:52:32 AMI'm also curious when I can give merit to other members?I wanted to show gratitude to one poster but I couldn't send some merit.You can give merit to others when you have available smerit. For each merit you earn, you will get 0.50 smerit. So, for each 2 merit earned, you will get 1 smerit which you can share with other.If you don't have smerit to share but you think a post deserves merit, make sure you report the post to LoyceV thread- [self-moderated] Report unmerited good posts to Merit Source

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: vifzor on June 21, 2022, 12:52:32 AMI'm also curious when I can give merit to other members?I wanted to show gratitude to one poster but I couldn't send some merit.To add to what Little Mouse have said, Bitcoin merit is not like Facebook, twitter or instagram likes where you  just scroll down, find a post and just click a button to like it. Here, things are a bit different, you have to have smerit to be able to give it out.HOW DO YOU EARN SMERIT?First, it starts by making good and quality posts, good posts come in different forms, it can come as a question, it can come as an answer to a question, it can be a suggestion, advice, market analysis, news, warning, it can be just about anything but must make sense and users must find it merit worthy to be able to merit the post.For a comprehensive breakdown of how to make quality merit worthy posts, i recommend you visit https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5098333.0, Read the entire post, it might teach you alot of things you dont already know.Goodluck.
